bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Hoffman to Laura Armistead Carter, December 14, 1928

div1.p: Hoffman describes his efforts to track down an Investigation Report of the Yellow Fever Commission at Carter's request.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Hoffman to Laura Armistead Carter, December 14, 1928
div1.opener:
FREDERICK L. HOFFMAN
CONSULTING STATISTICIAN
THE PRUDENTIAL INSURANCE COMPANY
OF AMERICA
EDWARD D. DUFFIELD, PRESIDENT
HOME OFFICE, NEWARK, NEW JERSEY
December 14, 1928
Miss Laura A. Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
We are in receipt of your letter of November 26,
inquiring about a supposedly missing volume of the Reports on the
Investigation of Non-Malaria Fevers in West Africa, published under
the direction of the Yellow Fever Commission, under the chairmanship
of J.K. Fowler.

I was in Washington myself the other day and looked
through the Prudential section at the Surgeon-General's Library, but
was not able to find this third Investigation Report you speak of.
There is however, a third Report in the set that is called “The Third
Report of the Yellow Fever Commission. I have therefore written
direct to the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine, as you will see
from the enclosed carbon copy. As soon as we hear from them, we shall
be pleased to get in touch with you again.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, F.L. Hoffman F.L.HOFFMAN
Consulting Statistician
